content.prompt: Which of the following is a traditional characteristic of lukasa, objects that are designed by the Luba peoples to recall specific lineages and oral traditions?

choices.label: They come in a wide range of shapes and sizes that reflect regional Luba culture.
They vary in surface details and added elements but maintain similar size and shape.
They can take the form of specific animals or recognizable human figures.
They convey specific words and letters that can be read, similarly to braille code.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Explain how a specific work of art (or group of related works of art) demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
